Package org.hypermedea

Class LinkedDataArtifact

  • java.lang.Object
    • cartago.Artifact
      • org.hypermedea.HypermedeaArtifact
        • org.hypermedea.LinkedDataArtifact
  • public class LinkedDataArtifact
extends HypermedeaArtifact

    Artifact for browsing Linked Data.

    The main operation of the ThingArtifact is get, to look a Web resource up. The resource may be identified by an http, https or file URI. If a relative URI is given as argument, it is assumed to be a file URI relative to the JaCaMo project's directory.

    The LinkedDataArtifact performs lookups in an asynchronous fashion, that is: a get operation returns before the RDF representation of the resource is fully downloaded. Several observable properties are exposed by the LinkedDataArtifact to manage pending lookups:

    • to_visit(URI) is added after a call to get(URI) and removed after the lookup has ended.
    • visited(URI) is added once a lookup has ended.
    • crawler_status(idling|crawling|error) is updated depending on whether lookups are pending or not.

    Once a resource is visited, the RDF statements found under its URI are added as observable properties of the LinkedDataArtifact. RDF statements have the form 

    rdf(S, P, O)[ crawler_source(URI) ] .

    where S, P and O are the subject, predicate and object of the RDF statement. The crawler_source annotation (within square brackets) holds the URI of the source for that statement, i.e. the URI given as argument of get(URI). A further annotation (rdf_type_map) gives the node type of each element of the triple (see RDFTripleWrapper for more details).

    See examples/fayol for an example with Linked Data browsing.

      • getParentURI

        public void getParentURI​(java.lang.String resourceURI,
                         cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.String> parentResourceURI)

        Expose the transformation function from a resource URI to its parent resource URI (without fragment, if any). For instance, the parent resource of 

        http://example.org/alice#me

        is

        http://example.org/alice
        Parameters:
        resourceURI - a resource URI
        parentResourceURI - the URI of the parent resource

      • get

        public void get​(java.lang.String resourceURI)
        Perform a GET request to retrieve an RDF representation of the provided resource. Add (asynchronously) the found RDF representation to the belief base.
